Changing Folder or Item Branching Behavior

Given the appropriate settings, folders, files, and change requests in a child view can be branched – that is, can be separated from the corresponding item in the parent view. Folders and change requests branch when their properties change, while files branch when either their contents or their properties change. Requirements, tasks, and topics can never branch.

After a folder or item branches, it receives a new revision number. For example, if the revision number of a file is 1.13 before the file branches, it becomes 1.13.1.0 after branching. The next change to the file in the parent view will receive the revision number 1.14.

Whether or not a folder, file, or change request has the ability to branch depends upon its history.

If a folder or item was in parent view at the time the branching view was created:

  • If the Branch all option was selected for the branching view, the Branch on change check box for the folder or item is enabled and selected. Therefore, the folder or item can branch.

  • If the Branch none option was selected for the branching view, the Branch on change check box for the folder or item is enabled but not selected. Therefore, the folder or item cannot branch, but its behavior can be changed.

If a folder or item was added to the branching view after the view is created:

  • The Branch on change check box for the folder or item is disabled and cleared. Therefore, the behavior of the folder or item cannot be changed. On the other hand, if you share that folder or item with a new view, its branching behavior becomes enabled automatically.

Before changing the branching behavior of a folder, keep in mind the fact that this setting determines whether new items can be added to that folder. New items can be added if the folder has already branched, if the folder has not yet branched but has its Branch on change check box selected, or if the added item has its Branch on change check box disabled.

If a folder has not yet branched and its Branch on change check box is not selected, new items cannot be added. If you attempt to do so, an error message will appear, stating that the folder is read-only.

Changing a folder’s branching behavior does not affect the behavior of items in the folder before the change, items subsequently moved to or shared with that folder, or items subsequently propagated to that folder from the parent view.

To review or change a folder or item’s branching behavior:

  1. Select the folder from the folder hierarchy in the left pane or the item from the list in the upper pane.

  2. Select Advanced > Behavior from the Folder or item menu. The Item Behavior dialog opens. If the folder or item can be made to branch, the Branch on change check box will be enabled.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Select the Branch on change check box if you want the selected folder or item to branch with the next change. If branching takes place, this check box becomes disabled, while the folder or item receives a new revision number which has two additional integers.

    • Clear the Branch on change check box if you want the selected folder or item to branch with the next change.

  4. (Optional) If you are changing the behavior of a folder, you can also change the behavior of its child folders simultaneously by selecting the Apply to entire folder tree check box.
